sections.text: FCCPS AI Advisory Committee
Values and Principles - Committee Guidance Packet
Version: Draft for Form 1 rollout
Figure 1. Values and Principles workflow (F1-F6).

heading_path: Purpose and what you are being asked to do
sections.text: This packet explains the committee's Values and Principles workflow (F1 through F6), how it builds on our Team Formation and Shared Baseline work, and how you can provide structured input through Form 1 and a follow-on Form 2. The goal is to produce a small set of board-ready policy principles and at least one tradeoff statement that can guide drafting, implementation planning, and the risk register.

heading_path: Purpose and what you are being asked to do
sections.text: Form 1: Approve or propose revisions to the F3 candidate clauses, tag tensions using TR codes, and choose options on key tradeoffs (T1-T7).

heading_path: Purpose and what you are being asked to do
sections.text: Form 2 (later): Select and cap the final merged principle set (8-12) after wording is finalized.

heading_path: Purpose and what you are being asked to do
What you will receive after Form 1 closes
sections.text: A change log (what changed and why).

heading_path: Purpose and what you are being asked to do
What you will receive after Form 1 closes
sections.text: A merge map (which approved clauses were absorbed into which seed principles).

heading_path: Purpose and what you are being asked to do
What you will receive after Form 1 closes
sections.text: A vNext set of merged, board-ready principles plus a primary tradeoff statement (and a backup, if needed).

heading_path: Purpose and what you are being asked to do
What you will receive after Form 1 closes
sections.text: A short Form 2 to confirm the capped set.

heading_path: How this work connects to Team Formation and Shared Baseline
sections.text: Team Formation created workstreams and assigned leads/co-leads so the committee can translate principles into coherent policy domains (instruction, assessment, equity, privacy/security, governance, communications, and implementation supports). This protects the process from single-lens dominance and ensures each domain has accountable owners for follow-through.

heading_path: How this work connects to Team Formation and Shared Baseline
sections.text: Shared Baseline work established common definitions, assumptions, and a shared picture of classroom realities and key claims/concerns we must address. These baseline outputs inform what should appear in F1 (risks/opportunities), what 'quality' means in F3, and what tradeoffs must be made explicit in F5.
The Values and Principles workflow moves from synthesized inputs to board-ready principles with explicit tradeoffs and a consent-based decision record.

heading_path: Non-negotiables that keep us moving (enforced quietly)
sections.text: Humans move cards. AI suggests; committee decides.

heading_path: Non-negotiables that keep us moving (enforced quietly)
sections.text: No Pass without sponsor initials (or a named sponsor in the form).

heading_path: Non-negotiables that keep us moving (enforced quietly)
sections.text: Use the 20-second rule in live review: if not resolvable quickly, move to Revise.

heading_path: Non-negotiables that keep us moving (enforced quietly)
sections.text: Avoid wordsmithing in F3/F4; aim for smallest edits that fix the quality issue.

heading_path: Non-negotiables that keep us moving (enforced quietly)
sections.text: Nothing is lost: Park and Cut lists preserve ideas for later implementation planning.

heading_path: Why this milestone matters for workstreams and the risk register
sections.text: Adopted principles and tradeoff statements serve as a checkpoint that allows workstreams to converge. Without a stable principle set, parallel drafting tends to diverge, producing contradictions, gaps, and late-stage rewrites.

heading_path: Why this milestone matters for workstreams and the risk register
sections.text: Each workstream can map draft guidance back to specific principles (traceability).

heading_path: Why this milestone matters for workstreams and the risk register
sections.text: Principles create common language for domain decisions (for example: what 'high-stakes' means, when disclosure is required, and what is prohibited by risk).

heading_path: Why this milestone matters for workstreams and the risk register
sections.text: Tradeoff statements provide a default posture when principles collide, reducing inconsistent decisions across workstreams.

heading_path: Why this milestone matters for workstreams and the risk register
How principles connect to the risk register
sections.text: Risks are recorded as: risk category  related principle(s)  default posture (tradeoff statement)  mitigations/guardrails  evidence/monitoring  ownership.

heading_path: Why this milestone matters for workstreams and the risk register
How principles connect to the risk register
sections.text: This structure turns risk discussions into actionable policy controls and monitoring commitments.

heading_path: How we will complete the work from where we are now
sections.text: In the meeting, we completed AI seed drafting and an initial F3 quality filter pass. The next step is to collect committee input on wording and tradeoffs through Form 1, then finalize merged wording and cap the set through Form 2.

heading_path: How we will complete the work from where we are now
sections.text: Form 1 (this round): approve or propose revisions to candidate clauses and select options for key tradeoffs.

heading_path: How we will complete the work from where we are now
sections.text: Facilitation synthesis: consolidate approvals, resolve conflicts with smallest-change edits, and build a vNext merged set plus tradeoff statement(s).

heading_path: How we will complete the work from where we are now
sections.text: Form 2 (follow-up): select and cap the final merged principle set (8-12) and confirm tradeoff statement(s) if needed.

heading_path: How we will complete the work from where we are now
sections.text: Ratification: record consent and any exceptions.

heading_path: F3 candidate sections: approve or propose revised text
sections.text: Approve: accept the clause as written (it will be merged into the stated seed principle if a merge target is listed).

heading_path: F3 candidate sections: approve or propose revised text
sections.text: Do not approve: propose alternate wording using the required format and keep it to one sentence.

heading_path: F3 candidate sections: approve or propose revised text
sections.text: Select up to 3 TR codes to indicate which decision lenses are in tension for this clause.

heading_path: F3 candidate sections: approve or propose revised text
sections.text: Use the comment box for boundary conditions or examples, not for full rewrites.

heading_path: Proposed revision format (required when you do not approve)
sections.text: Use this format in the Proposed Revision box:

heading_path: Proposed revision format (required when you do not approve)
sections.text: Heading (sentence case).

heading_path: Proposed revision format (required when you do not approve)
sections.text: FCCPS will ... (one sentence; clear actor + scope + constraint).

heading_path: Proposed revision format (required when you do not approve)
sections.text: Optional: suggested merge target.

heading_path: TR codes: decision lenses (select up to 3)
sections.text: TR codes help us summarize what the tension is about and maintain traceability.

heading_path: TR codes: decision lenses (select up to 3)
sections.text: TR1 - Learning impact and deep skills

heading_path: TR codes: decision lenses (select up to 3)
sections.text: TR2 - Assessment validity and academic integrity

heading_path: TR codes: decision lenses (select up to 3)
sections.text: TR3 - Equity, accessibility and inclusion

heading_path: TR codes: decision lenses (select up to 3)
sections.text: TR4 - Privacy, security and data minimization

heading_path: TR codes: decision lenses (select up to 3)
sections.text: TR5 - Student safety and developmental appropriateness

heading_path: TR codes: decision lenses (select up to 3)
sections.text: TR6 - Transparency, accountability and community trust

heading_path: TR codes: decision lenses (select up to 3)
sections.text: TR7 - Feasibility, workload and sustainability

heading_path: TR codes: decision lenses (select up to 3)
sections.text: TR8 - Evidence, monitoring and reversibility

heading_path: Tradeoff statements (T1-T7): choose an option and tag the lenses
sections.text: Pick Option A, B, or C (or select Need more info).

heading_path: Tradeoff statements (T1-T7): choose an option and tag the lenses
sections.text: Select up to 3 TR codes that explain why you chose that option.

heading_path: Tradeoff statements (T1-T7): choose an option and tag the lenses
sections.text: Use the comment field to propose a guardrail, exception, or hybrid condition.
We compute approval rates and triage disapprovals by dominant TR lens.
We consolidate competing edits using smallest-change, decision-language rewrites.
We produce a vNext merged set (8-12) with a cut list and a merge map.
We draft 1 primary tradeoff statement (plus 1 backup) grounded in the most contested collisions.
We publish a short change log before sending Form 2.
Review the vNext merged principle set and select up to 12 items for the capped list.
Optionally identify your top 3 priorities.
Confirm tradeoff statement(s) if the committee remains split after Form 1.

heading_path: Why this approach increases validity and traceability
sections.text: Stage separation prevents premature convergence: generation (F2) is separated from screening (F3) and consolidation (F4).

heading_path: Why this approach increases validity and traceability
sections.text: F3 criteria produce decision-guiding, testable principles rather than slogans or program plans.

heading_path: Why this approach increases validity and traceability
sections.text: Explicit tradeoffs (F5) make collisions predictable and reduce inconsistent downstream drafting.

heading_path: Why this approach increases validity and traceability
sections.text: Consent-based ratification (F6) increases the chance members can support the output publicly.

heading_path: Why this approach increases validity and traceability
sections.text: Sponsor initials preserve provenance for candidates and revisions.

heading_path: Why this approach increases validity and traceability
sections.text: Pass/Revise/Park decisions and TR lens tags preserve the rationale for changes.

heading_path: Why this approach increases validity and traceability
sections.text: Merge maps and cut lists ensure no idea disappears; it is either adopted, revised into another item, or archived for implementation planning.

heading_path: Why this approach increases validity and traceability
sections.text: Two-stage forms create a clear audit trail: what wording was approved, what alternatives were proposed, what tradeoffs were selected, and how the final set was capped.
Decision-guiding: would this help a leader or educator make a call?
Testable: could we tell if the principle is being followed?
Not implementation-specific: avoids naming specific tools, programs, or org structures unless essential.
Clear actor and scope: who does what, for whom, and when?
No hidden tradeoff: if a tradeoff exists, make it explicit or route to a tradeoff statement.

heading_path: Failure reason tags (FR) and what they mean
sections.text: FR1 Too vague

heading_path: Failure reason tags (FR) and what they mean
sections.text: FR2 Implementation detail

heading_path: Failure reason tags (FR) and what they mean
sections.text: FR3 Not testable

heading_path: Failure reason tags (FR) and what they mean
sections.text: FR4 Conflicts with another principle

heading_path: Failure reason tags (FR) and what they mean
sections.text: FR5 Actor unclear

heading_path: Failure reason tags (FR) and what they mean
sections.text: FR6 Needs tradeoff decision
TR1 - Learning impact and deep skills
TR2 - Assessment validity and academic integrity
TR3 - Equity, accessibility and inclusion
TR4 - Privacy, security and data minimization
TR5 - Student safety and developmental appropriateness
TR6 - Transparency, accountability and community trust
TR7 - Feasibility, workload and sustainability
TR8 - Evidence, monitoring and reversibility

heading_path: T1 Assessment validity: design-first vs restrictions
sections.text: Primary lenses: TR2, TR1, TR7 (secondary: TR8)
Primary lenses: TR2, TR3, TR6 (secondary: TR8)
Primary lenses: TR6, TR7, TR4 (secondary: TR3)
Primary lenses: TR6, TR4, TR7 (secondary: TR3)

heading_path: T5 Teacher feedback and AI assistance
sections.text: Primary lenses: TR1, TR7, TR6 (secondary: TR3)

heading_path: T6 Pilots, evidence thresholds, and off-ramps
sections.text: Primary lenses: TR8, TR5, TR7 (secondary: TR6)

heading_path: T7 Equity: non-AI path vs normalization
sections.text: Primary lenses: TR3, TR1, TR7 (secondary: TR6)
Why two forms?
Because Form 1 stabilizes wording and tradeoff posture. Form 2 caps the final list after the language is settled, improving signal quality.
Do I have to use the exact revision format?
Yes. One sentence with a clear actor and scope is required so edits can be compared and merged without rewording debates.
What if I am unsure?
Use 'Need more info' on tradeoffs and explain what information would change your view. For clauses, disapprove and propose a conservative rewrite if needed.
What happens to parked ideas?
They go to an implementation parking lot or options analysis. They are not deleted; they are deferred.

| Step | Purpose | What happens | Output artifact |
| F1 - Inputs | Define the problem space | Review synthesized top risks and opportunities (read-only themes). | F1 theme set |
| F2 - Candidates | Generate candidate principles | Use AI seed drafts plus human write-ins in decision language ("FCCPS will..."). | F2 candidate set |
| F3 - Quality filter | Make candidates board-ready | Pass / Revise / Park using a shared checklist; record failure reasons. | Pass/Revise/Park piles |
| F4 - Merge + cap | Create a usable set | Merge near-duplicates and cap to 8-12 principles; keep a cut list. | Merged principle set + cut list |
| F5 - Tradeoffs | Handle collisions explicitly | Draft 1 primary tradeoff statement (plus 1 backup) for collisions. | Tradeoff statement(s) |
| F6 - Ratification | Make decisions durable | Consent-first ratification; record exceptions and smallest-change requests. | Consent record + exceptions |

title: Purpose and what you are being asked to do
